name: Commonwealth v. Mayberry et al., Appellants

judges: Before Jonhs, C. J., Eagan, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and ManDERINO, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth v. Mayberry et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The judgments of contempt are affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

opinions.text:
Dissenting Opinion by
Mr. Justice Manderino :
I dissent because the defendants were entitled to a jury trial. See United States v. Seale, 461 F. 2d 345 (7th Cir. 1972); Commonwealth v. Patterson, 452 Pa. 457, 308 A. 2d 90 (1973) (Manderino, J., dissenting).
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Manderino :

attorneys: John J. Dean, Assistant Public Defender, with him George 3. Ross, Public Defender, for appellants.
J. Kent Gulley, Assistant District Attorney, with him Robert L. Eberhardt, Assistant District Attorney, and Robert W. Duggan, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Mayberry et al., Appellants.
Argued April 24, 1973.
Before Jonhs, C. J., Eagan, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and ManDERINO, JJ.
John J. Dean, Assistant Public Defender, with him George 3. Ross, Public Defender, for appellants.
J. Kent Gulley, Assistant District Attorney, with him Robert L. Eberhardt, Assistant District Attorney, and Robert W. Duggan, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
July 2,1973:
